item.title: Understanding Firefox Password Files
item.description: Recently I did some digging around Firefox and noticed that there is a logins.json file in the user’s profile folder. The file contains the stored usernames and passwords for websites in encrypted form. After a few brief searches I found a reference in a blog post to a tool called pwdecrypt which is part of Mozilla’s Network Secruity Services library (NSS). To install run: sudo apt install libnss3-tools If you found this information useful or have questions, follow or message me on Twitter: @wunderwuzzi23
